item.title: Fort Sumter Admission and Self-Guided Tour with Roundtrip Ferry
item.description: Visit the site where the American Civil War began without the hassle of arranging transportation or waiting in line for tickets with this Fort Sumter experience that includes admission tickets and round-trip ferry transport. Take in views of Rainbow Row and the Battery as you cruise through Charleston Harbor, then enjoy an hour at the fort to explore the historic fort and its museum before the return ferry ride.

image.alt: Fort Sumter Admission and Self-Guided Tour with Roundtrip Ferry

item.title: Boone Hall Plantation All-Access Admission Ticket
item.description: Boone Hall Plantation has had a long and fascinating history since its founding near Charleston in 1681. Learn about the estate and its place in South Carolina history by visiting the plantation with an all-access admission ticket. Nine original cabins where enslaved people lived, coupled with the Black History in America exhibit, demonstrate what life was like for many people at the plantation.

image.alt: Boone Hall Plantation All-Access Admission Ticket

item.title: Charleston Water Taxi Cruise with Dolphin Sighting
item.description: Explore Charleston by water taxi with this convenient harbor cruise. Utilize quick and scenic water-based transportation to reach several popular landmarks including Patriots Point Naval and Maritime Museum and the Aquarium. Check out attractions like Joe Riley Waterfront Park and the Charleston Harbor Marina at your leisure. Keep an eye out for dolphins during the cruise.

image.alt: Charleston Water Taxi Cruise with Dolphin Sighting

item.title: Charleston in a Nutshell Private Tours
item.description: This private sightseeing tour of Charleston offers a local perspective on the most charming city in the South. Beat the crowds of bus tours and go where carriage rides can’t as your licensed guide drives you around the peninsula in the comfort of a private vehicle. As you drive past top sights like Waterfront Park and the Battery, hear stories of Charleston history and culture in the Holy City.

image.alt: Charleston in a Nutshell Private Tours

item.title: 2 Hours Shem Creek Safari Kayak Tour
item.description: See a side of Charleston that most tourists miss with this unique kayaking excursion down Shem Creek. Pick up the basics of paddling, then set off with your guide toward Charleston Harbor to spot local wildlife from bottlenose dolphins and manatees to sea turtles and marine birds. Take in views of colorful shrimp boats and city skyline plus learn about Charleston’s history and ecosystem from your guide along the way.

image.alt: 2 Hours Shem Creek Safari Kayak Tour

item.title: Behind the Scenes of Shem Creek Shrimp Walking Tour
item.description: Get a look behind the scenes of the historic South Carolina shrimping industry with a guided walking tour of Shem Creek. This immersive experience will give you a chance to see this nearly century-old waterfront community at work, as you learn all about the history, ecology, culture, and language of this special place.

image.alt: Behind the Scenes of Shem Creek Shrimp Walking Tour

item.title: Charleston Shores Guided eBike Tour
item.description: See some of the prettiest parts of Charleston from the comfort of an electric bicycle with this tour. You'll visit elegant neighborhood streets flanked with Southern live oak trees covered with Spanish moss, cycle along the Ben Sawyer Bikeway on Sullivan's Island, and stop at Shem Creek Park, where you might spot dolphins and manatees.

item.title: Charleston Harbor & Marina E-Bike Tour
item.description: Explore the beauty and history of Charleston Harbor and Marina on this small-group e-bike tour. Your guide will show you the landmarks, including Ravenel Bridge, Waterfront Memorial Park, the naval vessels, and hopefully some wild dolphins. You’ll keep costs down by booking this small-group tour, and possibly make some friends too.

item.title: USS Yorktown Ghost Tour with Exclusive Night-Time Access
item.description:
Come aboard The USS Yorktown and hear the stories of the American Heroes who lived, died, and are still rumored to be here today. Commissioned in 1943, the “Fighting Lady” was once manned by over 3,000 people and designed to fight off enemies all over the globe during WWII. You will hear stories of their ultimate sacrifice and heroism as the people that once inhabited this ship dedicated their lives to the service of our country and to this great ship. This tour gives you exclusive night time access to areas of the ship that are closed to the public, including access to the flight deck after dark.
Highlights may include:
-Maritime Superstitions -Unusual Ship Christening -Captain Jocko Clark -Smokey Stover -Mysterious Sailor Disappearance

image.alt: USS Yorktown Ghost Tour with Exclusive Night-Time Access

item.title: Private Charleston Harbor Catamaran Sail
item.description:
Sit back and let us take the helm while you enjoy the harbor breeze aboard a Leopard 40 sailing catamaran. Our modern layout provides a panoramic view with large sliding glass doors between the saloon and the rear deck space, with an access door to the front of the boat. These features offer an open concept feel and easy navigation in and around the yacht. Better to see the dolphin and other happenings in the harbor! This innovative design also increases air flow and ventilation throughout the yacht, creating a more pleasant and breezy experience on the water. Catamarans provide a more stable ride on the water, giving ultimate comfort and relaxation while underway. Minimal leaning/heeling over. Owner/operators, captain Todd and wife Kathy, look forward to showing you the harbor and their beautiful boat.
Once you request a day, we will contact you to find a mutually agreeable time for our sail- or find us at Ezsailingcharters.com for up to date schedule.

item.title: Outer Banks Film Location eBike Tour in Charleston
item.description: Ride through the historical part of Mount Pleasant and discover the film locations featured in the Netflix series, “Outer Banks” on this guided tour by electric bike. See sites such as Pitt Street Bridge, Shem Creek, and more. Along the way, your guide will share interesting stories and take photos and videos of you and your group.

image.alt: Outer Banks Film Location eBike Tour in Charleston

item.title: Charleston Bird Watching Tour
item.description: We will explore birds and wildlife in beautiful Charleston, SC. The Pitt Street Bridge tour offers a guided walk along a former causeway that overlooks the Charleston Harbor with long views of downtown and the Ravenel Bridge. While enjoying the scenic views and beauty of the tidal marsh we will look for birds and other wildlife that flourish in this wonderful habitat. The marsh attracts a variety of birds including Herons, Egrets, Terns, Gulls, Sandpipers, Songbirds, Raptors, and Pelicans.

item.title: Parasailing Over Historic Charleston Harbor
item.description: Experience the thrill of parasailing over historic Charleston Harbor with this exciting adventure. Enjoy a safe and enjoyable adventure as you soar over the harbor taking in the stunning views. A professional staff, swing-style harness, and boat takeoff make for an unforgettable experience. Plus, you can choose from a morning or afternoon time slot to fit your schedule.

item.title: Charleston Shark Tooth and Fossil Searching Island Drop off
item.description: If you are wanting to explore one of the best places to find shark teeth and fossils than this is the trip for you. You will have four hours on one of Charleston's dredge islands that are replenished with shark teeth and fossils on every tide. This trip is perfect for all family members who enjoy the outdoors. For more pictures and trip facts look on my Facebook page Southern Anchor Charters.

image.alt: Charleston Shark Tooth and Fossil Searching Island Drop off

item.title: Charleston Inshore Fishing Charter
item.description: The inlets, sounds, bays, tidal creeks, marsh grass and oyster banks in our area make Charleston one of the top inshore fishing destinations on the East Coast, and for very good reason. With over slot redfish tailing in the grass to doormat flounder being pulled from the muddy bottom, our inshore charter is sure to inspire you to come back to our beautiful estuaries. That is why inshore charters are our specialty! Flounder, speckled sea trout, lady fish, or black drum are also popular amongst inshore anglers. Seasickness, big waves and wind are minimal for inshore charters, so these trips are perfect for families who do not want to deal with the harsh elements the sea can offer. While on your Charleston inshore fishing trip, you can expect to see more than just the fish we are targeting. Dolphins, manatees, sea turtles and otters frequent the area and often come close to our boats.

item.title: Afternoon Sail in Charleston’s Historic Harbor on a Catamatan
item.description:
Escape the hustle and bustle of the city and join us for a peaceful Afternoon Sail aboard the Palmetto Breeze, Charleston’s premier 50-foot catamaran. Perfect for soaking up the sunshine, this scenic sail offers a unique vantage point to explore Charleston’s historic harbor in a laid-back atmosphere.
As you cruise along the water, you’ll enjoy panoramic views of Charleston’s most iconic landmarks, including Fort Sumter, the USS Yorktown, and the stunning Ravenel Bridge. Whether you’re looking for a relaxing afternoon adventure with family, a unique date idea, or just a way to unwind with friends, our Afternoon Sail delivers the perfect blend of nature, history, and relaxation.

image.alt: Afternoon Sail in Charleston’s Historic Harbor on a Catamatan

item.title: Charleston Harbor Sunset Sail 50ft Catamaran Bar and Bathrooms
item.description: Step aboard the Palmetto Breeze for a breathtaking sunset sail through Charleston’s iconic harbor. As the sun sets behind historic landmarks like Fort Sumter and the Ravenel Bridge, you’ll enjoy a front-row seat to one of the city’s most beautiful sights. Relax with a drink from our onboard bar as dolphins and seabirds glide by, adding to the unforgettable experience. Whether you’re visiting Charleston for the first time or a local looking for a fresh perspective, this 2-hour sunset sail promises to be a highlight of your time here.

image.alt: Charleston Harbor Sunset Sail 50ft Catamaran Bar and Bathrooms

item.title: Charleston Harbor Sail Monday Ladies Night Catamaran with Bar
item.description: Calling all Ladies! Mermaid Monday is the ultimate ladies’ night out on the water. Gather your girlfriends for an evening filled with laughter, cocktails, and incredible harbor views as the sun sets over Charleston. Our lively 50-foot catamaran offers the perfect atmosphere for a fun, unforgettable night. Whether you're celebrating a birthday, bachelorette party, or simply need a night with friends, this sail is the ideal way to unwind and let loose. Join us for a magical, mermaid-inspired evening on the water!

image.alt: Charleston Harbor Sail Monday Ladies Night Catamaran with Bar

item.title: Aloha Wednesday Sunset Sail with drinks
item.description: Celebrate the island spirit aboard our Aloha Wednesday sail, where Charleston’s harbor meets tropical vibes. With complimentary beverages—including local beers, seltzers, and wine—this 2-hour sail is all about unwinding in style as you watch the sunset over the water. Let the ocean breeze carry away your worries while you relax on our spacious, comfortable catamaran. It’s a perfect midweek escape, and whether you’re with friends or family, Aloha Wednesday is an experience you won’t want to miss.

image.alt: Aloha Wednesday Sunset Sail with drinks
